data.fact: Unlike dogs, cats do not have a sweet tooth. Scientists believe this is due to a mutation in a key taste receptor.(FROM JSON)
When a cat chases its prey, it keeps its head level. Dogs and humans bob their heads up and down.(FROM JSON)
The technical term for a cat’s hairball is a “bezoar.”(FROM JSON)
A group of cats is called a “clowder.”(FROM JSON)
A cat can’t climb head first down a tree because every claw on a cat’s paw points the same way. To get down from a tree, a cat must back down.(FROM JSON)
Cats make about 100 different sounds. Dogs make only about 10.(FROM JSON)
Every year, nearly four million cats are eaten in Asia.(FROM JSON)
There are more than 500 million domestic cats in the world, with approximately 40 recognized breeds.(FROM JSON)
Approximately 24 cat skins can make a coat.(FROM JSON)

While it is commonly thought that the ancient Egyptians were the first to domesticate cats, the oldest known pet cat was recently found in a 9,500-year-old grave on the Mediterranean island of Cyprus. This grave predates early Egyptian art depicting cats by 4,000 years or more.(FROM JSON)
